text: Just a heads up on this, we've discussed adding social logins to forms natively in HubSpot. We previously had linkedin logins but the apis weren't stable enough and we didn't have much usage at all. For the moment we've decided not to press ahead with adding this feature as the work involved was far too high for the payoff our customers would see. But if you feel it would be useful I'd definitely encourage you to kudos and comment on that ideas post!

just curious, there’s another chrome bug I’ve been experiencing a lot and it’s infuriating. if a page has scrollable divs those divs can’t be scrolled using a mousewheel on mac.

this issue is not specific to any specific sites, it happens pretty much anywhere theres a div with overflow:scroll

Anyone else experiencing this? and have you found a work around?

I haven’t seen that. Seems to work fine for me if I inspect a random site and set stuff to ```height:500px;
overflow:scroll;```
You aren’t using any scrolljacking code?
i've noticed that in hubdb a lot

no scroll jacking, happens in incognito as well as with all extensions disabled. It’s just obnoxious.

And <@U26DA9CQ0> the issue only happens on page load if it has overflow scroll, haven’t noticed it happening if I add overflow scroll after page load
<@U7SL518D6> Can you send me an example?

the site I experience it most consistently on is <https://orion.managewp.com/> (when logged in)
(Their whole interface is a bunch of scrollable divs practically so it’s very noticable  there)
I don’t have a specific example right now otherwise, but it happens a lot.
And you aren’t using dev or Canary builds?
Also wondering if you can scroll in Gmail

I’m using the stable build of Chrome on Mac Latest build. 

I’ve seen the same issue on Canary though as well

And currently I can scroll in Gmail but think I’ve seen it have issue there before too.

No issues however in Google Inbox
Very strange! My first guess would be plugin, then it would be Chrome bug, then it would be broken mouse wheel :slightly_smiling_face:

it’s not the mouse itself, happens no matter what mouse I connect.

More bizzarely, if I use the touchpad on my computer, that works, it’s purely the scrollwheel
That really makes me lean toward it being the fault of some plugin that’s modifying the scroll events.
As I said it still happens with plugins disabled, therefore it’s a chrome or OS level bug
